data.question: What is the empirical formula of MOF 1?
What crystal system does MOF 2 belong to?
At what temperature were the single-crystal XRD data for compounds 1 and 2 collected?
What is the shortest Co–Co distance of adjacent surfaces in a channel for MOF 2?
What is the purpose of using Chiralcel OD-H column in the HPLC analysis of epoxides and diols?
data.answer: To separate enantiomers of the epoxides and diols.

data.question: How does the cooperative bimetallic catalysis work in the hydrolytic kinetic resolution of epoxides?
data.answer: Epoxide and H2O are activated simultaneously by two Co(salen) catalysts.

data.question: Is the MOF structure stable up to approximately 350 °C according to TGA analysis?
Does the MOF catalyst feature a high local density of cooperative bis[Co(salen)] motifs?
Can the solid catalyst be easily recycled and reused without any apparent loss of catalytic activity and enantioselectivity?
Is the catalytic activity of the MOF significantly lower than its homogeneous analogues at low C/S ratios?
Does the MOF catalyst improve catalytic performance relative to the monomeric catalysts at high C/S ratios?
Is the space group for MOF 1 and MOF 2 the same?
What is the role of DMF in the synthesis of MOFs 1 and 2?
data.answer: DMF acts as a solvent and participates in the coordination environment of the MOFs.

data.question: What is the significance of the chiral space group C2 in the structure of MOF 1?
data.answer: It indicates that MOF 1 has a chiral structure, which is important for its catalytic activity in asymmetric reactions.

data.question: What method was used to determine the enantiomeric excess (ee) values of the epoxides?
data.answer: High performance liquid chromatography (HPLC) with a chiral column.

data.question: What is the function of the Co(salen) units in MOF 2?
data.answer: They act as catalytic sites for the hydrolytic kinetic resolution of epoxides.

data.question: Is the conversion rate for the hydrolytic kinetic resolution of epoxides higher in the presence of MOF 2 compared to its homogeneous analogues?
What analytical technique was used to confirm the phase purity of the bulk samples of MOFs?
Does the presence of coordinatively unsaturated Ni2+ ions in MOF 1 contribute to its catalytic activity?
What is the role of circular dichroism (CD) spectra in the characterization of MOFs 1 and 2?
data.answer: To demonstrate the enantiomeric nature of the MOFs by showing mirror-image CD spectra for the R and S enantiomers.
